result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Cordova was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
**Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No THC. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
**Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
**If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court. Probation & Parole to notify the court, in writing, upon dirty UA or proof of possession/consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Cordova

records.addlTxt: DE to be released as to this case.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily K. Gaertner in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Alyssah M Foster in court for Juan Cordova. Defendant Juan Cordova in court, in custody. Clerk. M.Burke. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on 1 year probation with conditions; credit for 51 days served. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to DE in court.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with:  Monica V, Cynthia V,  The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

139PM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francisco Balistrieri.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered. Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:40 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 10:00 am. $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
